evidence: a periodic function like this can be broken down into many sine and cosine waves
These waves can vary in three ways: their frequency, which tells us how fast they oscillate; their amplitude, which tells us how tall they are; and their phase, which tells us where each wave starts
This wave-based view is the foundation for Fourier analysis
